text:
No part of the mind is unconditioned.  

Your mind is conditioned throughout.  

There is no unconditioned part of you.  

This is a fact, whether you like it or not.  

You may think of a part as unconditioned, but it is not.  

This part exists within the field of thought.  

Your mind is conditioned, both conscious and unconscious.  

Any effort to free itself is also conditioned.  

When you say, “I know I am conditioned,” do you truly know?  

Does this knowledge have the same impact as seeing a cobra?  

Realizing you are conditioned brings immediate action.  

The difficulty lies in understanding all its implications.  

The unconscious carries the weight of the past.  

Analysis cannot fully cleanse the unconscious.  

There is always an analyzer and the analyzed in analysis.  

This duality creates conflict and does not lead to freedom.  

I reject the analytical process completely.  

Understanding this frees me from analysis.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Your mind is entirely conditioned, and any effort to uncondition it is also influenced by that conditioning.
